alert.note: Alert for Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 19 at 12:12PM EST until December 20 at 4:41AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of East Central and North Central Maine, including the following counties, in East Central Maine, Penobscot. In North Central Maine, Piscataquis. * WHEN...Until 230 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Do not drive around barricades. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1210 PM EST, local law enforcement reported extensive flooding over southwestern Piscataquis County from runoff due to significant rainfall. Numerous roads are closed. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dover-Foxcroft, Dexter, Greenville, Guilford, Monson, Blanchard, Elliottsville, Kingsbury Plantation, Frenchtown, Sangerville, Garland, Parkman, Abbot, Wellington, Shirley, Willimantic, Beaver Cove, Bowerbank, Kingsbury and Onawa. - For flood safety http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
